required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reducing Breast Cancer Risk in Korean American Women
clinical_study.official_title: Reducing Breast Cancer Risk in Korean American Women

collaborator.agency: Korean Community Center of the East Bay

brief_summary.textblock:
The goals of the study are to develop a culturally and linguistically appropriate intervention to reduce SHS exposure for LEP Korean women using a family-focused intervention approach targeting Korean Americans ages 18 and above in the greater San Francisco Bay Area, CA, and to evaluate efficacy of the proposed intervention. The study is a single group feasibility trial targeting a total of 4 lay health workers (LHW) and 24 dyads of LEP Korean women with self-reported SHS exposure at home and a male household smoker. The hypothesis is:
H. Can a family-based intervention approach reduce SHS exposure among Korean American women who live with a current smoker?

primary_outcome.description: biochemically verified 7-day point prevalence of SHS exposure at 3-month post baseline (initiation of intervention)

secondary_outcome.description: Self-report of adoption of smoke-free home or car rules since program initiation

secondary_outcome.measure: Smoker's Utilization of smoking cessation resources
secondary_outcome.description: Use of evidence-based smoking cessation resources since program initiation
biochemically verified 7-day point prevalence of SHS exposure at 3-month post baseline (initiation of intervention)

arm_group.description: Quit Smoking For a Healthy Family - family-based psycho-education intervention using lay health worker (LHW) outreach.

intervention.description: Quit Smoking For a Healthy Family - This is a family-based psycho-education intervention using lay health worker (LHW) outreach. LHW will be trained to recruit smoke-family dyads and provide education and information about tobacco and health, and smoking cessation resources through 2 small-group education sessions and 2 individual phone calls over a 2-month period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- self-identified as Korean or Korean American;
- Korean speaking;
- reside in the San Francisco Bay Area
- plan to stay in the area for the next 3 months
- for women participants, the participant must report having SHS exposure at home at least 1 day in the past 7 days and live in the same household as the smoker participant to form a dyad.
- for the smoker participants, they must be male and have smoked at least 1 cigarette daily in the past 7 days.
- provide a valid contact telephone number for pre- and post-intervention assessments

eligibility.gender_description: Recruiting for male smokers and female household partner.

facility.name: Korean Community Center of the East Bay
